main event: A civilian clerk-typist working for the Army Finance Office in New Orleans saw a 'flying saucer' that was spinning and throwing off blue-white sparks on August 3, 1952. The object traveled at about 100 mph.
interesting points: The object was seen for 30-60 seconds.
The witness was lying on their back taking a sunbath when they noticed the object going through their field of vision.
The witness reported the sighting to the Fighter Squadron at Hamilton AFB and to the Intelligence Division of the 28th Air Division on August 3 and 4, 1952.
The witness was upright after the initial sighting, having been lying prone to sunbathe.
There were no audible sounds or smoke/vapor trails associated with the object.
sighted object: a spinning 'flying saucer' throwing off blue-white sparks
witnesses: civilian clerk-typist working for Army Finance Office
